'Cultural emphasis' is defined as an important aspect of a culture which is
often reflected though language and, more specifically, vocabulary (Ottenheimer,
2006, p.Â 266). This means that the vocabulary people use in a culture
indicates what is important to that group of people. If there are a lot of words
to describe a certain topic in a specific culture, then there is a good chance
that that topic is considered important to that culture.
